ALLEGATION:
Resident A alleged Staff 1 pushed a chair into her leg and threatened to beat her.
INVESTIGATION:
Resident A, age 16, is an abuse/neglect ward. She has been at Vista Maria for eight
months. I interviewed Resident A with Rights Advisor 1 present. On 2/26/20, she said
she complained to her DHHS worker and also filed an internal grievance pertaining to
this allegation. Rights Advisor 1 said he looked into the matter and did not find any
reliable evidence to support Resident A’s claim that Staff 1 intentionally hurt or
threatened her. Rights Advisor 1 said he and Resident A met on 2/27/20 to discuss a
mutually agreed-upon plan. The plan is in effect and involves separating Resident A
and Staff 1 for 21 – 30 days followed by a mediation meeting with both parties.
2

DCWL received this complaint on 3/6/20 after it had already been internally investigated
and resolved.
Asked about the allegation, Resident A said on 2/26/20, she and several other residents
were in the gym. Staff 1 intentionally pushed a rolling chair against her leg causing her
to break a fingernail. Then Staff 1 threatened to “beat her ass” if she told anyone.
I interviewed Staff 1 by phone. She has worked at the facility for six months. Staff 1
recalled that she and Staff 2 were in the gym supervising nine residents. “Resident A
and two of her peers kept walking out of the gym without permission. I called the
supervisor. She told me to close the gym door. Resident A was sitting on a chair in
front of the gym door. I asked her to move so I could close the door. She said ‘no,’ but
stood up. I moved the chair to the side. Resident A said I ran over her feet, but I did
not. I stood in front of the gym doors until the supervisor came.” Staff 1 denied ever
threatening to beat Resident A.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Staff qualifications.
(1) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position
assigned.
ANALYSIS: There is no evidence that Staff 1 threatened Resident A or
intentionally or unintentionally rolled or pushed a chair into her
foot or leg. Therefore there is nothing to indicate that Staff 1
does not have the ability or experience to perform the duties of
her assigned position.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDING:
Staff 1 said she was assigned to monitor a one-to-one resident while she was in the
gym with Staff 2 and eight other residents. That left Staff 2 in charge of eight residents.
The staff-to-resident ratio in this facility is 1:4. Staff 1 said the supervisor was working
as a direct care worker that day on her wing, but had to leave to perform security
checks. While the supervisor was away, the staff were out of ratio.
3

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4127 Staff-to-resident ratio.
(1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-
to-resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
ANALYSIS: The staff-to-resident ratio is 1:4. On 2/26/20, two staff were
monitoring nine residents in the gym. One of those residents
was on one-to-one status. A resident on one-to-one status and
her assigned staff person are not to be counted in the ratio.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION:
Once an acceptable corrective action plan is received, I recommend this facility
continue its current licensing status.
